name: Dubai
summary: The city with the world’s biggest everything.

all_steps.name: United Arab Emirates
all_steps.description: Here we are - day 70 of our trip around the world, country 10, and 3rd continent!

all_steps.name: Mall of the Emirates
all_steps.description:
Mall day! What else do you do when you are in Dubai? Even in October it is 100 degrees out (38 C)!

We went and saw Wild Robot! Fran and Robbie read and loved those books. We were the only ones in our theatre and it was fancy!

The mall was huge, even had an indoor ski resort.

all_steps.name: Aquaventure World Water Park
all_steps.description:
Today we went to the worlds largest water park. It holds the world record for the most water slides (105) and the world’s tallest waterslides.

We played from open until close. We had so much fun! Some of our favorites were Medusa’s Lair, Vortex, Immortal Falls, Blackout, and the Hydra Racer. Poseidon’s Revenge was the most memorable for sure (look it up, it is wild!).

all_steps.name: Persian Gulf
all_steps.description: We took the opportunity to swim in the Persian Gulf! It was bathtub warm!  Granted we were in the bay of the man made Palm Jumeirah archipelago, so it may have been extra warm.

all_steps.name: Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo
all_steps.description: Fran really wanted to go to the aquarium and it did not disappoint. It had a big walk through tunnel with sharks, rays, and other fish. We got to pet a brown banded bamboo shark, and see lots of other cool animals!

all_steps.name: Dubai Mall
all_steps.description: The Dubai Mall was even bigger then the last mall!  Second biggest in the world by land area. This is where the aquarium was. It also had an ice skating rink and it’s own China town!

all_steps.name: Burj Khalifa
all_steps.description:
Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters (2,717 ft) tall and holds several world records, including:
Tallest freestanding structure
Tallest skyscraper to the top of the spire
Building with the most floors (163)
World's highest elevator installation
World's highest restaurant

In front each night, the Dubai Fountain out front does a water fountain show. It was designed by the same group that did the Bellagio Fountain in Las Vegas. The Dubai Fountain is the world’s tallest performing fountain shooting water up to 500 ft (152.4 m) into the air.

all_steps.name: Dubai 2nd Ward
all_steps.description:
Today we went to church with the Dubai 2nd Ward (this side of the world they watch general conference next week). The ward meets in a conference room at the Grand Mercure hotel across from the airport. It is an English speaking ward (the Tagalog ward meets in the morning). It was probably the biggest ward we have attended since Washington. The Abu Dhabi Stake includes 7 wards and 3 branches. This is the church's only ecclesiastical area without a mission and proselytizing is prohibited in Middle Eastern countries. Even still, the church is big and growing here. We were able to see a member who was baptized yesterday get confirmed.

Fun Fact: President Nelson announced a temple to be built in Dubai in the April 2020 General Conference. This announcement came from following a gracious invitation from the Dubai government to build the temple. 

I am so glad we were able to go to church today in this ward. It was a great meeting with very friendly people. Fran was able to share her testimony again.

all_steps.name: Dubai Monorail
all_steps.description:
The metro in Dubai is an elevated monorail. It is the cleanest metro we have been in yet, and very easy to use. But super crowded when we rode it. But the people have been nice and almost always offer there seats to us.

On our way home from church, it was SUPER crowded. Fran was sitting on my lap. The guy across from us,  a large, older, Indian man, was sleeping. Like snoring super loud sleeping. We didn’t think too much of it, but then the train went over a bump and the man was flown forward on top of us. Some guys standing in the aisle had to pull him up - it took a couple of them because of his large size and it being dead weight. He was still mostly asleep and even when they got him back in his seat, he was still very out of it. It was crazy and hilarious! Good thing our stop was next, so we didn’t have to experience anything like that happening again, because he wasn’t waking up!
